page.title: 18SHREWTON PARISH CHURCH
page.content: St. Mary's is now the main village Parish Church of Shrewton. The Norman building was rebuilt in 1855 using Chilmark stone and flint. The square clock tower contains six bells which are rung regularly on Sundays and on special occasions. The stained glass windows are small and arched. The roof is supported by a series of tall pillared archways which are decorated with carved stone figures. The alter table stands on a mosaic tiled floor with a brass cross in the centre and two brass candle sticks on either side. A new Childrens' corner has just been created to occupy young children during church services. A thriving choir has 15 members who practice weekly, and lead the singing each Sunday and at special ceremonies such as weddings.
